title: SH 121 Rayburn Turnpike construction photos

pageHeader.title: Construction of Main Lanes
pageHeader.subTitle: 2004, from Denton Tap Road to the Dallas North Tollway

text: This section of SH 121 was under construction as a freeway at the time these photos were taken, but the project was converted into a toll road on September 9, 2004, to finance the main lanes to McKinney. These photos start at Denton Tap road and proceed east to the Dallas North Tollway.

images.caption: This view looks east, west of Denton Tap road.
Overpass construction at Denton Tap Road.
Looking towards MacArthur Boulevard, with overpass construction in progress on the right side of the photo.
This phase of construction added four connectors at the five-level intechange at I-35E.
This view looks southbound along IH-35E, with the piers for a high-level connection ramp on the left side of the freeway.
Moving eastward, here is the overpass at Hebron Road.
This is just west of 121 business.
The interchange with 121 business is just ahead.
Looking northeast at the intersection at SH 121 business on the east side of Lewisville.
East of the 121 business interchange, SH 121 is back on its original alignment. This view shows a very short section of mainlane pavement that is in place.
The same view as above, at a slightly different angle.
SH 121 was a four-lane divided highway with numerous traffic lights going eastward.
Utility relocation is in progress in preparation for the freeway construction.
The first phase of the interchange with the Dallas North Tollway was completed in April 2004.
